revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=GlobalScale |model=DreamPlug (003-DS2001) |revision=V7R1 |upc=793573032386 |asin=B0053GBB5Y |price=150 |fcc_date=03/25/2011 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=Yes |type=plug computer |fcc_id=YCJ003-DS2XXXB, YCJ003-DS2XXXW |pwr_v=100-240 |pwr_amp=0.25 |pwr_conn=NEMA 1-15P |pwr_vac=true |pwr_ac_hz=50-60 |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88F6281;88F6281A2; |cpu1_cspeed=1.2 GHz |fla1=2 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L1606EM2I-12G |fla2=2 GiB |fla2_brand=SanDisk |ram1=512 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=HY5PS1G831CFP-S6 |ram1_num=4 |expansion_if_types=SD Card, microSD, eSATA 2.0, USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |expansion_sata_num=1 |jtag=yes,, 8-pin header,, populated,, J15 |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, populated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200,8,N,1),, J8 |wi1_module=AzureWave AW-GH381 |wi1_module_if=SDIO (module) |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8688 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Marvell |eth_chip2_model=88E1116R |eth_chip3_brand=Marvell |eth_chip3_model=88E1116R |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports=1 |flags=schematics, Bluetooth 2.1+EDR, SPDIF out, RTC w/ battery backup, |stock_boot=U-Boot; |stock_os=Linux; |tp_firmware=FreedomBox, Debian, Ubuntu |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=Plug2-uAP-XXXX |default_ssid_regex=^Plug2-uAP-[a-f0-9]{4}$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=root |default_pass=nosoup4u |oui=00:24:23 |oui_eth=F0:AD:4E }} [http://www.globalscaletechnologies.com/t-dreamplugdetails.aspx Product page]
This is the default hardware platform of the [http://freedomboxfoundation.org/ ''FreedomBox'' project] as of June 2012. :[http://wiki.debian.org/FreedomBox/DreamPlug ''DreamPlug'' on the '''Debian Wiki'''] :[http://plugcomputer.org/plugwiki/index.php/DreamPlug ''DreamPlug'' on the '''PlugWiki''']
The '''DreamPlug''' is covered by two FCC IDs... *YCJ003-DS2XXXW - Wi-Fi filing *YCJ003-DS2XXXB - Bluetooth filing
"Dream_Plug_V7R1" and "GLOBALSCALE" is silkscreened on the main board.
Per the FCC docs... *This device is using the following '''Genesys Logic''' chips :GL836 SD/MMC/MS card reader IC :GL850G USB 2.0 hub IC *The model nubmer is 003-DS2001. *Wi-Fi is 802.11b/g, Bluetooth 2.1+EDR supported :By default, the '''DreamPlug''' starts WiFi in AP mode. Default SSID format of '''Plug2-uAP-XXXX''' ('''XXXX''' is 4 hex digits, lower case letters) :'''WiGLE''' indicates that the device uses a 00:24:23 ('''AzureWave''') OUI The wireless module is presumably an [[AzureWave AW-GH381]]. :Other model '''DreamPlug'''s may come with 88W8787 based (802.11bgn) Wi-Fi modules..
Schematics and a block diagram of the device are available in the FCC docs.
*[http://kgilmersden.wordpress.com/2011/06/08/first-look-at-the-globalscale-dreamplug/ ''First look at the Globalscale Dreamplug'' on '''Ken's Digital Den'''] (WP blog) :"Dream_Plug_V8R1" is silkscreened on the board. :F0:AD:4E ('''GlobalScale''') OUI for Ethernet interfaces :2 MB Serial Flash (MX25L1606EM2I-12G) on the board :4x '''hynix''' HY5PS1G831CFP-S6 (1Gbit [128Mbit x 8], DDR2, PC800) RAM chips :2x [[Marvell]] 88E1116R GbE PHYs :'''C-Media''' CM108 USB audio controller Detachable power supply (barrel connector on the logic portion)
This model may come with a 2 GB internal microSD card. :The '''GlobalScale''' site specifies that it comes with a 4 GB microSD card, :however, the site also specifies the device supports 11b/g/n.. :The '''PlugWiki''' page states the device comes with 512 MB of NAND :(the pads are unpopulated on the FCC photos and Ken's photos).
By default, '''Debian''' selects the '''mv643xx_eth''' :(''MV-643xx GbE driver version 1.4'') module.
